newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi lifts tobacco customs duty to 100 percent.
newsitem.headline: Saudi lifts tobacco customs duty to 100 percent.

text.p: Saudi Arabia has raised the customs duty on tobacco and related products to 100 percent from 50 in line with a Gulf Arab accord to curb tobacco consumption, a customs official said on Sunday.
"Saudi Arabia started implementing the new tariffs from July 1," the official at Jeddah Islamic Port told Reuters.

The six-nation Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) held a meeting in January to coordinate the implementation of a phased increase to 100 percent agreed by a GCC summit in Doha in 1996. The GCC groups Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Oman, Qatar, Bahrain and Kuwait.
Gulf Arab leaders in December agreed to lift the minimum tariff on tobacco products from 50 percent to 70 percent.
The GCC secretariat has said the duties would be increased again in 2000.
